author: Green_Bricks
title: Great set for display
review:
Hi everyone! This is my first attempt at a critical review on this site, but I've chosen my most recent set (which, might I add, I am a big fan of) to launch into the firing line.

I bought this for £11.99 discounted, at the opening of a new Smyths toy store using a promotional voucher. As much as I like the set, I also like a good deal, so waited to get this one at a cheaper price that I thought was fair and adequate. Believe me, from experience these sets go down in price, so avoid it at full price if you can.

Besides this grudge, the set made for a relaxing, 20-30 min build in front of the latest episode of Channel 4's 'Lego Masters'! The shaping on Ron's hair was interesting and clever, the attachment of Dumbledore's beard surprised me in how well hidden it was, the decorated tiles were all printed and the sets look great when complete. I have a small collection of BrickHeadz who live together in my room, so I have kept these two with them. The set contains minimal repetition of building small subparts, and works with bricks going in all directions.

Pros:

- Fun build

- Good looking for display

- Interesting and useful pieces (printed tiles, glasses, jumper, etc)

 

Cons:

- Not enough to justify the full price

- Cannot be played with (but this is the same across the whole theme, so only targeted at those who would use it as a toy)
